author: megan.dit
title: Auditability through film and media
description: No existe un proceso sencillo para que la comunidad siga las propuestas financiadas que ofrezcan una supervisión y un seguimiento completos.

f6_assessments.q0: La comunidad necesita desesperadamente información sobre los proyectos en curso. Esta propuesta, en resumen, ofrece la creación de un canal de youtube para informar sobre los proyectos relacionados con la AMA con vídeos que se subirán semanalmente. Esto se alinea con los objetivos del desafío, ya que proporcionará visibilidad a la comunidad.  El planteamiento del problema habla de proporcionar una "supervisión integral completa". Sin embargo, la propuesta no explica realmente lo que esto significa, por lo que la puntuación es de 4. Una adición útil a esta propuesta habría sido definir los parámetros en torno a los cuales están trabajando (por ejemplo, ¿los vídeos serán charlas generales con los proponentes o se centrarán en la entrega del proyecto o los resultados o el impacto o todo lo anterior?)
f6_assessments.q1:
La viabilidad de esta propuesta es bastante difícil de descifrar a partir de la información proporcionada.
Se menciona una lista de 8 recursos nombrados, pero no sabemos realmente quién va a realizar el trabajo.
No hay pruebas de que ninguno de ellos tenga experiencia en la producción de vídeo o en la gestión de un canal de youtube. Esto no me preocupa demasiado ya que, por experiencia, se puede aprender con bastante facilidad.
No hay un plan real de actividades o de hitos en el que se detallen las actividades de los próximos 6 meses. El plan parece ser tan simple como crear plantillas, entrevistar a los proponentes y subir los vídeos. Esto está bien, pero podría haber sido más claro con los hitos intermedios, por ejemplo, un MVP con un bucle de retroalimentación.
El presupuesto tiene 4 partidas que me resulta difícil relacionar con el plan y los recursos. 3.000 dólares para viajes, 1.000 dólares para formación, 1.000 dólares para marketing. La sección del presupuesto es el único lugar donde se mencionan estas actividades.

Como el presupuesto es relativamente pequeño y por experiencia la creación de un canal de YouTube no es una gran tarea ya que la puntuación de 3 se da en base a la confianza y la reputación que wada ha construido en la comunidad.

Para futuras propuestas, los proponentes deberían trabajar en la alineación del plan con el presupuesto y los resultados con los hitos. Esta es una tarea bastante sencilla y hay algunos buenos ejemplos en el Fondo 7. También pueden pedir ayuda a los mentores o a la comunidad. Esto no sólo les obligará a cuestionar sus planes de entrega, sino que facilitará a todo el mundo la comprensión de sus intenciones.
f6_assessments.q2:
Se ofrecen algunos objetivos, pero son de carácter general y no son realmente medibles por la comunidad. Por ejemplo, la propuesta habla de subir vídeos semanales o quincenales (aunque esto podría significar dos veces por semana o cada dos semanas) para muchos proyectos. Una medida específica habría sido que para todos los (¿10?) proyectos de wada financiados hasta el fondo 6 se produjera un vídeo semanal.
En resumen, una gran idea. El detalle de la entrega necesita ser trabajado, sin embargo los votantes deberían sopesar esto contra el proyecto relativamente simple, la reputación de wada y el modesto presupuesto.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer state the problem in detail and offer the solution using templated visual journey for audit is a great idea. The series will obviously attract viewers, hopefully broader viewers globally - to have a sense of the journey
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team were backup by WADA team which is already known within the community. But they might want to consider hiring a professional video content producer / team - making a semi-documentary is not as easy as it looks, they might need some help from the pros - considering the budget requested.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes proposer give enough data for audit although a measurable number will help the community to track the progress for. ex "Increased activity in YT channel by X %"

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is a lovely idea. A video template can serve as a great way to smooth out the reporting process, because it standardizes an important part of the auditing process. It could also give the Cardano community something nice to show to future proposers, or anyone curious. If this proposal fails I hope the proposers give it another shot.
f6_assessments.q1: White the feasibility portion of this proposal cites the team's previous success in receiving funding for their work, it has yet to be launched, and both advisors and voters aren't provided with anything to see. A sample would go a long way, and since this is a visual/video proposal you'd think it would be doable to show us some of the work that is being considered for this template. Otherwise, sadly, we're operating in the dark.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided appears adequate and the funding requested is reasonable. I'm more qualified to speak on the procedural and communications aspects of this project than I am on the technical side, so I'll just reiterate that this project is a fantastic idea that suffers from being presented as not much more than an idea. But since the team is already in the process of producing audiovisual material, I'll also re-emphasize that, should this request not receive funding, I hope they try again.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal identifies a problem which needs to be solved and has a compelling solution statement and I think it is a good idea as a means of broadcasting the achievements of the Catalyst fund, Well done.

The proposal does not however clearly articulate how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem due to lack of clearly defined metrics and goals. It would be helpful to include information about the parameters that you wish to report on and how this reporting will take place, for example the use of graphs to display projected sales against current sales.
The lack of key metrics and goals means I am unable to assess how well the proposal aligns with the outlined challenge settings as none of the key metrics are referred to.
In my opinion, proposal would be unable to successfully scale without sound fundamentals required to enable it to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer does not demonstrate sufficient knowledge of auditing or how they wish to measure the performance of the catalyst proposal, nor is there any evidence of any persons with such knowledge relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal on their team.
The budget is not outlined clearly, nor broken down into identifiable items. It remains unclear whether the proposer wishes to produce all content based on actual footage from all projects on the Continent. Considering the size and demographic of the area it would not be possible or feasible to conduct such an operation on such a small budget. Therefor I feel the budget not reasonable will unlikely achieve the set goals. The project plan does not clearly define key achievable or metrics that could be used to see if the achievable are been reached. The proposer has failed provided a verifiable plan in this regard.
f6_assessments.q2:
Whilst a roadmap exists it is vague with milestones and a time horizon for achievement not clearly defined. The metric referred to in the challenge brief have not been referred and it remains unclear how the project aims to align with these objectives. You could aim to set your objectives using the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, Timeframed) methodology to assist with this.
It is my opinion that the proposer does not fully Clear understand the description of the targeted problem as whilst the proposal does well to address the broadcasting of the achievements of funded catalyst projects, it does not address the key metrics that would be used as a measure for success

f6_assessments.q0:
Interesting approach do auditability. Generally this is done by plain documentation and video would certainly bring a more "human component" to this process at the same time it allows funded proposers to proper explain all the development done, in words and images.
However, the documentation part still would be essential as it is really proof of what was done. The proposer here understands this and offers, together with the video, a place to keep this documents. Having everything in a dedicated platform, and with a standard template, would defintely make things easier and help community.
I also see this proposal very aligned with challenge as it would increase the "Number of reports, articles and videos/podcasts".

The only reason I didnt give 5 start here is because it is still unclear how much work would have to be put on to make these videos. Usually, this kind of media demand much more effort (and specific knowledge of tools and design) to be ellaborated, even with a template, than a regular documentation (word documents, spreadsheets, powerpoints). My concern is that funded proposers might not want to make the videos (either because of time it takes or because they dont know how to do them) and this project ends up being not very broadly adopted. To overcome this, it could be included in the scope of the project some support/training on creating the videos, besides providing the template, a possible way to outsource the creation of these videos (even if with a small fee) or other ways to facilitate the creation of this content. It could also be mentioned how was the impact, in a quantitative manner, of their previous funded proposal (Wada Media Funnel for Proposers), that involved video creation as well. It would clarify how prone proposers are to create these medias.
f6_assessments.q1:
As this this team has already developed a similar project in past funds, initially I'd say this proposal is generally feasible but it lacks some key information, that I describe in the sequence, that makes me give only a 3 score/star. First, more information on the team experience, person by person (it is mentioned mostly their area of expertise), and links to verify the information, as linkedin links, would be necessary. 

Second, budget breakdown could better explained. For instance, it says "Travel and security logistics " but it could explain somewhere why these trips are necessary. "Team costs" could also be better ellaborated (is it just to pay the team or involve other kind of costs? how much will be paid per hour or per peson?).

Last, There's a simple roadmap but it is not time-framed and only some vague actitivites are described. This roadmap could be better organized in months/weeks, with more straightfoward tasks, deliverables and main milestones per period.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are good time-framed milestones but no KPIs. It would be imporant to measure and follow up with how many audit videos are being made by funded proposers, how much time they are spending on it, how many people are watching and assess if this is really a better way to audit projects. Maybe it would be hard to set target on all them initially but their experience with past funded proposals could be used to give some sense on these targets (even if within a range)
The first bullets in the auditability part seems more related to engagement between proposers and community than the proposal itself.

f6_assessments.q0: This follow-up proposal builds on work that has been started in Fund5. The aim is to follow-up proposers' journey via short video and frequent communication. As such this is a fantastic idea that, once refined, could be scaled up globally. It delivers on the requirements of the auditing challenge and functions as a marketing tool for WADA / Catalyst in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1: This is not only good return on intention but solid Return on Investment. The budget of $9,000 USD sounds very low for a European but in Africa it can be enough to deliver what has been planned. Going forward, as Catalyst grows in popularity, it might not be feasible anymore to follow the "FULL journey from idea creation to implementation". Perhaps the team needs to focus only on funded proposals. That doesn't diminish the current feasibility of the proposal, however. Manfo, Megan and the team have proven their ability to deliver quality results.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is very easy to track the progress by keeping a watchful eye on the YouTube channel. Perhaps the KPIs and goals could be made more measurable although, understandably, they are dependent on the amount of proposals coming in.

(Avoid the use of ambiguous term "bi-weekly" because for some it means every two weeks and for others twice a week).

solution: Crear una plantilla a través de las redes de medios de comunicación de Wada para seguir a los proponentes en todo su recorrido, desde la creación de la idea hasta su plena aplicación después de la financiación.
experience: Red Wada, y canal de youtube
